paragraph.heading: 1Debug output
paragraph.paragraph:
In both trees of the
00_introduction.xml object tool , objects are displayed. For virtually all objects, it is possible to display a user-definable string value next to the object address.

To do so, inherit from the class
DEBUG_OUTPUT in the classes that should let their objects display a string value, and implement the `debug_output' feature. At run-time, the debugger will automatically query the result of this feature on all objects that define it and display it in the object tool and the
../50_expression_evaluation/index.xml evaluation tool .
paragraph.sample:
Sample: The
NUMERIC class inherits from the
DEBUG_OUTPUT one so that it is possible to see the value of *_REF objects without expanding them.
paragraph.tip:
Tip: If an object has a long string output or an output with carriage returns, for instance, pick-and-drop it to the expanded display command
../../../../../images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_expand_string_color.gif in the object tool.
